Providing memorable, educational experiences

One educational experience outside of the classroom can change a child’s entire perspective on learning and help them achieve higher results

What we do

M7E provides free, curriculum based experiences for schools with a high proportion of PP children. Each trip will be led by the school but based outside of the classroom and fully funded by M7E. All planning and collateral for the trips will be completed by M7E so that teachers can continue to use their time planning and teaching outstanding lessons.

“Our mission is to increase engagement within classrooms by providing memorable, curriculum related experiences outside of them.”

Why we do it

One educational experience can change a child’s entire perspective and research shows that experiences outside of the classroom are the most likely to have a positive impact. This could range from getting more girls into STEM from an early age or introducing any child to a world of art that inspires them to delve deeper into the subject.

What do schools think?

'The attention to detail, which included full risk assessments, itinerary and transport was wonderful. The trip had been planned with maximum fun while allowing a complete learning experience in a safe environment'

- Assistant Head Teacher - DSLV School

If you're interested in hearing more and arranging a trip we'd love to hear from you!
